design_system.name: Playful Focus
design_system.description: A vibrant, accessible, and engaging design system for educational games. Prioritizes clarity, high contrast, and friendly aesthetics.

buttons.base: padding: 12px 24px; border-radius: 16px; font-weight: 700; transition: all 0.2s ease; cursor: pointer;
buttons.primary: background: var(--primary); color: white; border: none; box-shadow: 0 4px 12px rgba(99, 102, 241, 0.3);
buttons.secondary: background: var(--secondary); color: var(--text-primary); border: 1px solid var(--border);

cards.base: background: var(--surface); border-radius: 24px; border: 1px solid var(--border); box-shadow: var(--shadow-medium);

inputs.base: padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 12px; border: 2px solid var(--border); background: #F8FAFC; font-family: inherit;
inputs.focus: border-color: var(--primary); outline: none; box-shadow: 0 0 0 4px rgba(99, 102, 241, 0.1);

accessibility.contrast_ratio: Ensure 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text

steps: Replace the Google Fonts link with the new one for Nunito and Open Sans.
Update the :root CSS variables to match the new 'Playful Focus' color palette.
Refine the '.container' class to use the new background and softer shadows.
Update '.btnPrimary' and '.btnSecondary' to use the new button styles (remove harsh gradients, use solid colors or subtle gradients).
Redesign the '#card' (Prompt Card) to be cleaner: White background, large dark text, subtle border. Remove the 'floatGlow' animation if it's distracting, or make it very subtle.
Update the 'Bento' grid for stats: Make each stat (.stat) a separate white card with a colorful icon or border.
Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, inputs) have the new focus styles.
Update the 'Feedback Overlay' to use the new success/error colors and cleaner typography.
Add 'data-testid' attributes to all key elements: #startBtn, #resetBtn, #checkOrder, .choiceCard, .orderWord, #studentName.
Ensure the layout remains responsive (mobile-first approach).
